def_en: A pile of things is a mass of them that is high in the middle and has sloping sides.

def_cn: （一个压着一个摆放整齐的）叠，摞
def_en: A pile of things is a quantity of things that have been put neatly somewhere so that each thing is on top of the one below.
If you pile things somewhere, you put them there so that they form a pile.
If something is piled with things, it is covered or filled with piles of things.
If you talk about a pile of something or piles of something, you mean a large amount of it.
If a group of people pile into or out of a vehicle, they all get into it or out of it in a disorganized way.

def_cn: （尤指富人或要人居住的）高大宏伟的建筑物
def_en: You can refer to a large impressive building as a pile, especially when it is the home of a rich important person.
Piles are wooden, concrete, or metal posts which are pushed into the ground and on which buildings or bridges are built. Piles are often used in very wet areas so that the buildings do not flood.
Piles are painful swellings that can appear in the veins inside a person's anus.

def_cn: （地毯或织物的）绒面，绒毛，绒头
def_en: The pile of a carpet or of a fabric such as velvet is its soft surface. It consists of a lot of little threads standing on end.

def_cn: 处于（社会或某组织的）下层/上层
def_en: Someone who is at the bottom of the pile is low down in society or low down in an organization. Someone who is at the top of the pile is high up in society or high up in an organization.
